channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Greetings from Afrin, Syria, where Kurds danced their hearts out to celebrate spring
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international correspondents share moments from their lives and work around the world.

item.title: These students protested the Gaza war. Trump's deportation threat didn't silence them
item.description: NPR spoke with two international students about their decision to continue speaking out despite the government's aggressive effort to deport pro-Pales...

item.title: Retailers feel pressure to eat the price increases from tariffs
item.description: From Target to Walmart, retailers are fighting two battles at once: a financial battle to keep costs low in the face of new tariffs, and a political o...

item.title: South African president visits the U.S. And, GOP divided over Trump's tax bill
item.description: South Africa's President Cyril Ramaphosa is set to meet President Trump today in an attempt to reset relations between the two countries. And, House R...

item.title: A brain-dead woman's pregnancy raises questions about Georgia's abortion law
item.description: A Georgia woman declared brain dead is being kept on life support because she is pregnant. It raises complicated legal questions about restrictive abo...

item.title: "Never Too Late": Anthony Mason pursues painting passion
item.description: Painter Sharon Sprung teaches CBS News senior culture correspondent Anthony Mason how to paint as he pursues a longtime passion at the Art Students Le...

item.title: Democratic Rep. McIver is due for first court appearance on assault charges
Most AAPI adults oppose college funding cuts and student deportations, a new poll finds
R&B star Chris Brown freed on £5m bail by London court
item.description: The US singer is accused of assault at a nightclub in central London in 2023.

item.title: Latest details on Trump's visit with House Republicans, "Golden Dome" plans

item.title: Watch: Tornado tears roof off factory in Tennessee, severe weather continues in central U.S.
item.description: Tornadoes and severe storms continue to tear through the central and southern parts of the U.S., including Tennessee and Alabama. CBS News' Nicole Val...

item.title: X restricted in Tanzania after police targeted by hackers
item.description: After being compromised, explicit images and misinformation were shared on the police's account.

item.title: Canada in talks with US to join Trump's Golden Dome defence system
item.description: PM Mark Carney's office says there are "active discussions" on the Golden Dome, but it's too early to say how Canada would join or pay in.

item.title: Minnesota wildfire interactive maps show how far infernos have spread
item.description: Three massive wildfires continue to rage north of Duluth in northeastern Minnesota.

item.title: West Nile virus detected in UK mosquitoes for first time
item.description: A UK Health Security Agency spokesperson said the risk to the general public is "very low".

item.title: Ukrainian ex-top official shot dead outside Madrid school
item.description: Andriy Portnov, 51, had just dropped his children off when he was attacked.

item.title: Trump and Musk meeting with South Africa's president amid tensions
item.description: South African-born billionaire Elon Musk will join President Trump's meeting with South African President Cyril Ramaphosa.

item.title: Arrested New Orleans jail worker says he helped inmates escape after stabbing threat
item.description: Authorities have arrested an Orleans Parish Sheriff’s Office maintenance worker in connection with the escape of 10 jail inmates.
